title: LTE (Lifting The Exponent) Deep Dive
content:
Statement

If p is an odd prime dividing a-b, then for n\in\mathbb{N}, v_p(a^n-b^n)=v_p(a-b)+v_p(n). Variants exist for a+b and p=2.

def v_p(n,p):
    c=0
    while n%p==0:
        n//=p
        c+=1
    return c
print(v_p(2**12-1,3), v_p(3**25-1,5))

Hard Problem

Find all integers n such that 7^n-3^n is divisible by 2n+1.

Solution Sketch

Analyze orders modulo 2n+1 and apply LTE to compare valuations; handle small exceptional cases separately.
